Shopify Size Chart Section

Learn how to create a Size Chart section with Sections Pro in Shopify

Description of the Section

The "Size Chart" section is a customizable and responsive feature designed to help your customers understand the sizing options available for your products. By providing this information in a clear and accessible format, you can reduce return rates and improve customer satisfaction. This section allows you to specify sizes across different labels, customize the appearance with various font and color options, and adjust section dimensions to fit seamlessly within your store's design.

Demo of the Section

Installation Instructions

  1. Download the Sections Pro app on the Shopify App Store
  2. Open the app and navigate to Free Sections
  3. Search for "Size Chart"
  4. Click to Publish or Purchase

Sample Use Cases for a Shopify E-commerce Store

  1. Clothing Stores: Provide customers with a detailed size chart for various clothing items such as shirts, pants, and dresses.
  2. Footwear Shops: Display size conversions for different shoe sizes across different regions (US, UK, EU).
  3. Accessory Shops: Show size variations for items like hats, gloves, and belts.
  4. Sportswear Stores: Offer clear size charts for sports jerseys, workout apparel, and athletic wear.
  5. Luxury Boutiques: Enhance customer experience by offering precise measurements for tailored suits and custom dresses.

Overview of the Configuration Settings

  • Text Settings:
    • Text Font: Choose from various fonts to match your store's typography.
    • Text Size: Select a size (ranging from 10px to 50px) to ensure readability.
  • Color Settings:
    • Background Color: Customize the section's background with a gradient or solid color.
    • Text Color: Change the text color to ensure it stands out against the background.
    • Border Color: Set the color for table borders to enhance readability and aesthetics.
  • Dimension Settings:
    • Max Width of Section: Define the maximum width of the size chart section in pixels.
    • Padding: Adjust the padding (top, bottom, left, right) to add space around your content.
    • Table Padding: Set the padding inside the table cells for a cleaner look.

Moreover, the section includes blocks for defining various sizes (XS, S, M, L, XL) which can be labeled and filled with relevant size data according to your specific product range.
